wikitext.*:
{{disambig-two|the Elvish root|Quenya word|[[or]]}}

'''OR''' (also '''ORO''' and '''RŌ''') is a [[Primitive Quendian]] [[Sundocarme|root]] signifying "rise, mount". The reverse root is said to be [[NŪ|NŪ, NDŪ]] ("sink, go down").<ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}, pp. 63-4, 112, 171 (roots appearing as "√OR-", "ORO", "RŌ", "√OR/RŌ")</ref>

In a letter, [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] noted the root '''ŌR/RO''', signifying "rise up, go high".<ref name=L347>{{L|347}}, p. 426 (root appearing as "√ŌR/RO")</ref> 

==Derivatives==

*[[Quenya]]: ''[[Rómen|Rōme(n)]]''; ''[[orna|ornā]]''; ''oro'', ''orto'' ("mount, mountain"); ''oro-'' ("up, aloft"); ''[[orta-|órta-]]''<ref name=PE17/>
*[[Sindarin]]: ''[[ered|orod]]''<ref name=PE17/>

*?[[Primitive Quendian]]: ''ornē'' ("tree")<ref name=L347/>
**Quenya: ''[[orne]]''<ref name=L347/>
**Sindarin: ''[[orn]]''<ref name=L347/>

Quenya ''[[óre]]'' ("heart (inner mind)", [[Telerin]] ''ōre'', and Sindarin ''gûr'', are said to be associated with [[Common Eldarin]] OR,<ref group=note>Editor [[Carl F. Hostetter]] links the mention of "√OR" to the base ORO- appearing in the ''Etymologies''.</ref> although probably not "semantically connected".<ref>{{VT|41c}}, p. 11 (root appearing as "√OR")</ref>

==Other versions==

In the ''Qenya Lexicon'' appears the roots ORO (with the descendant [[Qenya]] form ''oro-'' "rise") and RŌ, ROHO (with the descendant Qenya ''rōna-'' "arise, rise, ascend").<ref>{{PE|12}}</ref>

In the ''[[The Etymologies|Etymologies]]'' appears the roots ORO- ("up; rise; high") and RŌ- ("rise"). Among the derivatives are:<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, pp. 379, 384</ref>

*ORO-
**[[Quenya]]: ''[[óre]]'' ("rising"); ''[[orta-]]'' ("rise, raise")
**[[Noldorin]]: ''[[or]]'' ("above"); ''ortho'' ("raise"); ''erio'' ("rise")
**ÓROT- ("height, mountain")
***Quenya: ''oron'' ("mountain"); ''orto'' ("mountain-top")
***Noldorin: ''[[ered|orod]]''; ''[[orodrim]]''
***[[Doriathrin]]: ''orth''
**ÓR-NI- ("high tree")
***Quenya: ''[[orne]]''
***Noldorin: ''[[orn]]''
***Doriathrin: ''orn''

*RŌ-
**Quenya: ''[[rómen]]''; ''rómenya'' ("eastern"); ''róna'' ("east") 
**[[Kornoldorin|Old Noldorin]]: ''róna'' ("east")
***Noldorin: ''[[Rhûn#Etymology|rhûn]]'', ''[[amrûn#Noldorin|amrûn]]''

==See also==

*[[Sindarin]] ''[[oron#Sindarin|oron]]'' ("†tree")
